summary: The science of magnetism is old. It has been known since ancient times that magnetic materials tend to point in the north-south direction; like
hypothetical_questions: Where can we typically find magnetic materials pointing north-south?
Why do we consider magnetism something old, even though we are only studying it today?
What does the north-south direction mean in the context of magnetism?
